p: The effective and environmentally sustainable management of arthropod vectors is of great relevance and has attracted the attention of researchers for centuries [ 1, 2, 3, 4]. Mosquitoes (Diptera: Culicidae) are currently recognized as the most important vectors in terms of public health importance, playing a crucial role in the spread of malaria, yellow fever, dengue, West Nile, Rift Valley fever, Japanese encephalitis, chikungunya and Zika virus, just to cite a few examples [ 5, 6].
